forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 13 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night lingers over Downtown San Francisco, the air is thick with the promise of rain, an occasional gust playing with the shadows cast by the still-sleeping city. Above, a quilt of clouds rests heavily, reflecting the moon’s gentle glow, while the cool wind, whispering through the streets at about thirteen miles per hour, carries with it the scent of damp earth. The temperature drapes a comfortable chill around you, resting near 48 degrees but with the day's potential for a high that struggles to breach 54. Beneath these brooding skies, expect a persistent, yet mildly optimistic, 50% chance of showers—each drop a reminder of the transition from winter’s embrace.

As dawn breaks, those atop the hill will see a dance of sunlight and cloud, a partly sunny day emerging despite the looming possibility of more rain. Whether you venture out for a quiet morning walk, perhaps tracing the curves of the Embarcadero, or decide to linger over a warming cup of coffee at one of the neighborhood cafes, dressing in layers is advisable. A light jacket to shield against the zephyrs, paired with water-resistant footwear, will serve you well against the impending drizzle. Today, while the landscape may seem like a watercolor painting of muted tones, the city buzzes softly with life, suggesting a low-key exploration of its neighborhoods would be well worth your time.
